description: From the Latin lūcubrātiō (“nighttime study”), from lūcubrō (“work by artificial light”), from lūx (“light”).

entries.meaning: Intense and prolonged study or meditation; especially, late at night.
The product of such study; often, writings.
examples: There is General Blair. True, his lucubrations on negro supremacy are ludicrous enough, but it will not do to speak lightly of his ability. There is power in his organization.
